706644f-a.title: Brooklyn: Schermerhorn Street - Bond Street
706644f-a.text:
Schermerhorn Street, north side, west from Bond and beyond Hoyt Stree s.
May 29, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

706645f-a.title: Brooklyn: Schermerhorn Street - Bond Street
706645f-a.text:
(1)
Schermerhorn Street, south side, near Bond Street. A view of the
Roman Catholic Church of Our Lady of Mercy.
April 24, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a further view towards Nevins Street.
March 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

706647f-a.title: Brooklyn: Schermerhorn Street - Bond Street
706647f-a.text:
(1)
Schermerhorn Street, east from Bond Street. The excavation was made as part of the work on the municipal Independent Subway. The theatre on the north side of the street is Loew's "Melba"f a movie house) with the Brooklyn Bureau of Charities Building at the rear.
July S, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same; the follewing year.
April 13, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
706647f-a.folder: Schermerhorn Street & Bond Street, Brooklyn, NY

706648f-a.title: Brooklyn: Schermerhorn Street - Bond Street
706648f-a.text:
Schermerhorn Street, adjoining and at the N. E. corner of Bond Street, viewing west toward the latter. Mars'Food shop replaced a three-story residence. On the west side of Bond
Street is Loeser's Department Store.
June 15, 1940
L. Sperr

706649f-b.title: Brooklyn: Schermerhorn Street - Bond Street
706649f-b.text:
285 Schermerhorn Street, north side, between Bond and Nevins Streets, showing the Brooklyn Bureau of Charities Building.
View 2 is viewing eastward and shows also (extreme
2right) the Odd Fellows Memorial Building.
View 1: June 6, 1933
View 2: June 15, 1940
P. L. Sperr
